text:
Just been hit with a charge for a little over a grand, one of my processes tried to place a bet Saturday morning without a persistence type got rejected and ended up trying again in a infinite loop. It was only when I woke up am stopped the code I’d realize what I had done..... totally my fault and I accept that however these surely can’t be counted as transactions as no bet was placed?!? 

I’ve been doing this for 3 years now and never been hit with a transaction charge, I don’t think I get close to the 5000 per hour limit.

Has anyone ever had such a charge over turned or is it likely betfair will just be “screw you, you’re paying it”

elements.text: Just been hit with a charge for a little over a grand, one of my processes tried to place a bet Saturday morning without a persistence type got rejected and ended up trying again in a infinite loop. It was only when I woke up am stopped the code I’d realize what I had done..... totally my fault and I accept that however these surely can’t be counted as transactions as no bet was placed?!?
I’ve been doing this for 3 years now and never been hit with a transaction charge, I don’t think I get close to the 5000 per hour limit.
Has anyone ever had such a charge over turned or is it likely betfair will just be “screw you, you’re paying it”

text: Transaction limit includes failed transactions

elements.text: Transaction limit includes failed transactions

text: Send an email to Neil on the bdp address, apologise and if it’s your first he might waive it

elements.text: Send an email to Neil on the bdp address, apologise and if it’s your first he might waive it

text: Yeah it’s the first time I’ve got close to paying it, I’ll drop him an email now, thank you

text: I think my commission covered it so it was a non issue, but id contact Neil like the boys have suggested (was my first port of call). It was due to a connection issue their side, leading to their systems being out of line. I sent a cancel order  up, but they kept sending EXECUTABLE back down so I got stuck in an infinite loop similar to you.

text: I had a similar issue many years ago (prior to having to pay for API live key charges were introduced) where a bug in my code resulted in my exceeding the limits at the time. I received a warning email but no charges. This was a good while back though on the old SOAP API. I was grateful for the this even though the charge was not large as I was a student at the time. Seems they are toughening their stance on a few API related things recently.

text:
I’m sure plenty of people have done it, we all know how easy it is to end up in an infinite loop.

They have really toughened up on a few things this year I’m just hoping that they look at this sympathetically and realise it was an honest mistake and a grand is excessive!

You must have been doing this for a while then if you started off on the SOAP api!

text:
Nothing, no email or notification, just saw my balance drop.

It was 10:20 am and there was nothing to bet on at that time so I initially thought I had been hacked!

I was on the morning stand-up for my day job too, had to turn the camera off because I was shocked and didn’t know what had happened

text: A loss - started a new strategy, let It run and walked out the door. Very careful with anything new from then on.

text: Also been caught out by non runners and the market reforming.

text: Yeah controls are important, flumine would block this, thinking about adding a request counter within bflw itself that could be used to prevent this happening

elements.text: Yeah controls are important, flumine would block this, thinking about adding a request counter within bflw itself that could be used to prevent this happening

text:
I do have controls in place but this just slipped through the net, it’s actually an old strategy that I brought back this weekend.... it was originally written before the controls were.

We all make mistakes and I’m not embarrassed or beating myself up over it, I just hope I don’t end up forking out a grand because of it.

To be honest tho, I’ve not heard back from either Neil or customer services. I’m not counting on getting this back.

I should really take a look at flumine, not done so yet because I’m not a fan of python. I only joined the page to see how many other people were perusing bot-trading and it’s been quite eye opening.

text: It is fixed now (at least for me). Happened last week (well that was when I noticed it. For me it got horse racing market totals all wrong but ONLY on the web page. Downloading excel dump for it and calculating totals gave correct results, but the web page itself refused to calculate the correct totals. And ONLY for horses. Totally bizarre behaviour, but it does work for me now and matches the API results. Would love to know what it didn't work because every market total was correct but it could not sum them correctly.

elements.text: It is fixed now (at least for me). Happened last week (well that was when I noticed it. For me it got horse racing market totals all wrong but ONLY on the web page. Downloading excel dump for it and calculating totals gave correct results, but the web page itself refused to calculate the correct totals. And ONLY for horses. Totally bizarre behaviour, but it does work for me now and matches the API results. Would love to know what it didn't work because every market total was correct but it could not sum them correctly.
